<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zd812ff2f1f864accb114b19e1cff730a" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: 21.3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(i)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">Adjusted 
EPS is a non-IFRS measure which aims to reflect Caledonia&#8217;s ordinary 
trading performance.&#160; Refer to Section 10 for a discussion of non-IFRS 
measures</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">6</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Revenues in the 
Quarter were 28.4% higher than Q2 2015 (the &#8220;comparable quarter&#8221;) 
due to a 20.3% increase in ounces sold from 10,401 ounces to 12,510 ounces and a
6.8% increase in the average realised price of gold from $1,173 per ounce to 
$1,252 per ounce.&#160; The royalty rate payable to the Zimbabwean government 
remained unchanged at 5%.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Production costs 
increased by 7.5% due to increased production and sales.&#160; The cost per 
tonne milled in the Quarter fell by 9.8% compared to the comparable 
quarter.&#160; The all-in sustaining cost per ounce of gold sold fell by 9.2%
from $1,030 per ounce in Q2 of 2015 to $935 per ounce in the Quarter because 
fixed costs were spread over higher production tonnage and higher 
sales.&#160;&#160; Costs are discussed further in Section 4.6 of the 
MD&amp;A.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Administrative 
expenses were 4.8% lower following measures taken in previous quarters to reduce
overheads, including the closure of operations in Zambia in mid-2015. 
Administrative expenses are analysed on note 7 to the Unaudited Condensed 
Consolidated Interim Financial Statements.&#160; Approximately 35% of total 
administrative expenses relate to employee costs in Harare, Johannesburg and St 
Helier.&#160; The other largest component of administrative costs is legal and 
other costs relating to Caledonia&#8217;s general corporate affairs including 
regulatory and tax compliance in all relevant jurisdictions</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">With effect from 1 
January 2016 the functional currency of the Company was changed from Canadian 
dollars to US dollars.&#160; Thus foreign exchange movements in the profit and 
loss in the Quarter and henceforth will only relate to gains and losses arising 
on US dollar-denominated cash balances and inter-company loans which are held by
CMSA (which has the South African rand as its functional currency) and rand-
denominated intercompany loans which are held by the Company.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company made Long
Term Incentive Plan (&#8220;LTIP&#8221;) awards in the first quarter of 2016 to 
certain executives in the form of Restricted Share Units (&#8220;RSUs&#8221;) 
and Performance Share Units (&#8220;PSUs&#8221;).&#160; To avoid equity dilution
for shareholders, RSUs and PSUs will be settled in cash, reflecting the 
prevailing Company share price at the maturity of the award and no shares will 
be issued as a result of the LTIP awards.&#160; The LTIP charge in the Quarter 
reflects a combination of the following factors: the change in the 
Company&#8217;s share price; the increase in the number of RSU&#8217;s due to 
the re-investment of attributable dividends and the erosion of the time period 
until vesting.&#160; Further information on the calculation of the charge is set
out in note 8 to the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial 
Statements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On May 16, 2016 the 
Company announced that Blanket Mine had sold Bills issued by the Government of 
Zimbabwe for a gross value of approximately $3.2 million.&#160; The Bills were 
issued to Blanket in 2015 and replaced the Special Tradeable Gold Bonds 
(&#8220;Bonds&#8221;) which were issued to Blanket in 2009.&#160; The Bonds were
issued as part consideration for gold sales that were made by Blanket in 2008 
under the terms of the sales mechanism that existed at that time for Zimbabwean 
gold producers.&#160;&#160; The Bonds were fully written down in a previous 
accounting period, and the impairment value was applied as a deduction from 
Blanket&#8217;s income tax liability.&#160; The gross sales proceeds are treated
as income in the Quarter which was subject to Zimbabwean income tax at 
25.75%.&#160; The net proceeds are deducted for the purposes of calculating 
adjusted earnings per share<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1;
font-size: smaller">5</sup></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In February 2016, the
Company entered into a derivative contract in respect of 15,000 ounces of gold 
over a period of 6 months. This contract expired in July 2016.&#160; The maximum
potential cost of the hedge was $435,000 (being the difference between the 
collar value of $1,050 per ounce and the cap value of $1,079 per ounce 
multiplied by the number of ounces that were subject to the contract) which was 
recognised in Q1 2016.&#160; Caledonia retained full upside participation at a
gold price above $1,079 per ounce.&#160; Margin calls were deducted from the 
margin that Caledonia deposited with the hedge counter-party in February 2016. 
The contract expired in July 2016 and there was no further adverse cash flow 
effect arising from the contract.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">_________________________________</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><sup style="vertical-
align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size: smaller">5</sup> Adjusted earnings 
per share is a non-IFRS measure which aims to reflect Caledonia&#8217;s ordinary
trading performance. Refer to Section 10 of this MD&amp;A for a discussion of 
non-IFRS measures</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">7</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The tax expense for 
the Quarter comprises: $1,624,000 of deferred tax at Blanket due to the 
difference between the accounting tax treatments of capital investment; $622,000
of Zimbabwean income tax arising on the sale of the Bills less a tax credit; 
$148,000 of Zimbabwean withholding tax on the payment of management fees from 
Blanket to CMSA and a tax credit of $13,000 arising at CMSA.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The non-controlling 
interest is 16.2% of the net profit of Blanket which is attributable to 
Blanket&#8217;s Indigenous Zimbabwean shareholders and reflects their 
participation in the economic benefits generated by Blanket from the effective 
date of the indigenisation.&#160; This is explained in Note 5 of the Unaudited 
Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The adjusted earnings
per share is a non-IFRS measure which reflects Caledonia&#8217;s ordinary 
trading performance and is calculated on the share of profit attributable to 
Caledonia shareholders excluding foreign exchange profits or losses, non-cash 
items such as the charges for deferred tax and non-recurring profit or loss 
items such as the Zambian administrative expenses which were incurred in the 
comparative quarter and the net sale proceeds of the sale of the Bills.&#160; 
Refer to Section 10 of this MD&amp;A for a discussion of non-IFRS 
measures.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Risks that may affect
Caledonia&#8217;s future financial condition are discussed in Section 17 of the 
MD&amp;A.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The table below sets 
out</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">the consolidated statements of cash flows for the quarter and 
six months to June 30, 2016 and 2015 prepared under IFRS.</font></div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash generated from 
operating activities is analysed in Note 13 to the Unaudited Condensed 
Consolidated Interim Financial Statements.&#160; Cash generated from operating 
activities in the Quarter is higher than the comparable quarter and includes the
non-recurring gross proceeds of $3,203,000 arising on the sale of the Bills by 
Blanket.&#160; Cash generated by operations before working capital changes in 
the Quarter was $7,526,000.&#160; Changes in revenues and operating costs are 
discussed above in the discussion of the consolidated statement of profit or
loss and other comprehensive income.&#160; The unrealised portion of the maximum
potential loss on the hedge of $54,000 and the charge of $250,000 in respect of 
the share based payment expense arising from the LTIP awards to senior 
executives were added back to operating profit as they are not cash expenses in 
the Quarter.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">8</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Investment in 
property, plant and equipment in the Quarter was $4,926,000 in terms of the 
Revised Investment Plan, which is discussed further in Section 4.7 of this 
MD&amp;A and in sustaining capital investment.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The dividends paid in
the Quarter relate to the quarterly dividend paid by Caledonia on April 29, 2016
of 1.125 US cents per share.&#160; No dividends were paid in the Quarter or in 
the comparable quarter by Blanket following the suspension of Blanket&#8217;s 
dividend payments with effect from January 1, 2015 so that all cash generated by
Blanket can be used to fund the Revised Investment Plan as described in Section 
4.8 of this MD&amp;A.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Shares issued were 
following the exercise of share options.</div>

Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The table below sets 
out the consolidated statements of Caledonia&#8217;s financial position at June 
30, 2016 and 2015 prepared under IFRS.</div>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Trade and other 
receivables are analysed in note 11 to the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated 
Interim Financial Statements.&#160; The increase in receivables during the 
Quarter is due to the increased receivable in respect of bullion sales to 
Fidelity Printers and Refiners: the amount receivable at December 31, 2015 was 
zero due to restrictions on bullion deliveries over the New Year holiday period;
the receivable at June 30, 2016 reflects a normal level and the amount due was 
received in full shortly after the end of the Quarter.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Blanket has an 
unsecured $5 million facility with a Zimbabwean Bank which was undrawn at June 
30, 2016 and is repayable on demand.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following 
information is provided for each of the eight most recent quarterly periods 
ending on the dates specified.&#160; The figures are extracted from underlying 
unaudited interim financial statements that have been prepared using accounting 
policies consistent with IFRS.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our quarterly results
fluctuate materially from quarter to quarter primarily due to changes in 
production levels and gold prices but also due to the recording of impairments 
and other unusual costs and income such as indigenisation and the sale in Q2 of 
2016 of the Bills by Blanket. Significant changes relating to prior quarters are
discussed in the relevant MD&amp;A&#8217;s and financial statements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z77a242cb819f4a95ba5f297a12bdd385" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 28.35pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">4.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">OPERATIONS AT THE BLANKET GOLD MINE, ZIMBABWE</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

quarters.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There was an
improvement in the safety performance at Blanket Mine in the Quarter, which 
reflects extensive management attention to this area in the Quarter and in 
previous quarters.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">4.2</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY:
inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Social Investment and Contribution to the Zimbabwean 
Economy</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Blanket&#8217;s 
investment in community and social projects which are not directly related to 
the operation of the mine or the welfare of Blanket&#8217;s employees, the 
payments made to the Gwanda Community Share Ownership Trust 
(&#8220;GCSOT&#8221;) in terms of Blanket&#8217;s indigenisation, and payments 
of royalties, taxation and other non-taxation charges to the Government of 
Zimbabwe and its agencies are set out in the table below.</div>

<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">10</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Payments to the Zimbabwe government were higher in the Quarter 
compared to the preceding quarter due to higher royalty payments due to the 
higher prevailing gold price and sales ounces and the tax payable on the profit 
arising on the sale of the Bills by Blanket.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z9c81d4630f81486bb5173616c188a8e6" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 28.35pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">4.3</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Gold 
Production</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Tonnes milled, 
average grades, recoveries and gold produced during the Quarter, the preceding 9
quarters and July 2016 are shown in the table below.</div>

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gold production in 
the Quarter was 369 ounces above target.&#160; Mine production and grade are 
discussed in Section 4.4 of this MD&amp;A; gold recoveries are discussed in 
Section 4.5 of this MD&amp;A.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z861950b7997b48ecae443bf90b422428" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">4.4</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Underground</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As set out in 
Sections 4.7 and 4.9 of this MD&amp;A, Caledonia announced the Revised 
Investment Plan for Blanket Mine on November 3, 2014.&#160; The objectives of 
the Revised Investment Plan are to improve the underground infrastructure and 
logistics and allow an efficient and sustainable production build-up.&#160; The 
infrastructure improvements include the development of a &#8220;Tramming 
Loop&#8221; (which was completed in June 2015), the sinking and equipping of the
No.6 Winze (which commenced production at the end of Q1 2016) and the sinking of
a new 6-meter diameter Central Shaft from surface to 1,080 meters (which is 
scheduled to commence production in mid-2018).</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Completion of the 
Tramming Loop in June 2015 substantially improved the underground logistics 
which means that more material - ore and waste - can be transported 
underground.&#160; The tonnes hoisted in the Quarter represent a new record from
underground mining.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The No. 6 Winze and 
the Decline development into the AR South ore body below 750 meters were both 
completed at the end of March 2016 and provide access to ore below 750 meters. 
In the Quarter 8,644 tonnes of ore were mined from below 750 meters.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Following completion 
of the 750 haulage to the Eroica ore body and subsequent development, this area 
is now a significant contributor to mine production.&#160; Eroica provided 19.5%
of total mine production in the Quarter.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The head grade in the
Quarter was 3.47 g/t compared to a plan of 3.32 g/t and 3.16 g/t in the 
preceding quarter.&#160; The improved grade was partly due to increased 
production from higher grade areas such as Eroica between 750m and 630m where 
the trammed grade was 5.32g/t and AR South below 750m where the achieved grade 
was 4.76g/t.&#160; In other areas there was continued focus on grade control to 
reduce dilution.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">11</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">4.5</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Metallurgical 
Plant</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Plant throughput was 
58.3 tph which was lower than the plan of 61.5 tph due to limitations on the re-
grind mill cyclone and cyclone feed pumps, both of which have now been replaced,
increasing the capacity of this system to 70tph with the option to upgrade it 
further to 80 tph.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Plant recovery 
increased from 93.0 % in the preceding quarter to 93.1%, mainly due to the 
improved feed grade from 3.16g/t to 3.47 g/t as discussed in Section 4.4.&#160; 
Recoveries were adversely affected due to reduced retention time in the CIL 
circuit due to planned tank refurbishment and continued difficulties with the 
very old oxygen plant.&#160;&#160; Management continues to evaluate options to 
replace the existing oxygen plant.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Capital projects at 
the metallurgical plant include:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z188eb2353f0d4980a865fec155e38e68" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">replacement of the cluster 
cyclones, as discussed above; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z55329e866c054b498618cb766ff53d27" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">preparation work for the new
ball mill which will increase milling capacity from 1,500 tonnes per day to 
1,900 tonnes per day and thereby accommodate the planned increase in mine 
production from quarter three of 2016 to full production at 1,800 tonnes per 
day.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 36pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z0860e941fec141a693425ebcad513b82" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">4.6</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Production Costs</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A narrow focus on the
direct costs of production (mainly labour, electricity and consumables) does not
fully reflect the total cost of gold production.&#160; Accordingly, cost per 
ounce data for the Quarter and the comparative quarter have been prepared in 
accordance with the Guidance Note issued by the World Gold Council on June 23, 
2013 and is set out in the table below on the following bases:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z39244c60945c4e4b907df7274bfdf1ff" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">i.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">On-mine 
Cost per ounce</font><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-
size: smaller;FONT-WEIGHT: bold">6</sup>, which shows the on-mine cash costs of 
producing an ounce of gold;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">ii.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">All-in 
Sustaining Cost per ounce</font><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-
height: 1; font-size: smaller;FONT-WEIGHT: bold">5</sup>, which shows the On-
mine Cost per ounce <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">plus</font> additional costs incurred 
outside the mine (i.e. at offices in Harare, Johannesburg and St. Helier) and 
the costs associated with maintaining the operating infrastructure and resource 
base&#160; that are required to maintain production at the current levels; 
and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

activities that are undertaken with a view to increasing production.</td>

</table>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">&#160;</div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

</td>

valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>

</table>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Per-ounce costs are 
calculated on the basis of sales and not production, so that an accurate value 
can be ascribed to the royalty.&#160; A reconciliation of costs per ounce to 
IFRS production costs is set out in Section 10.1</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On mine cost per 
ounce fell by 12.6 per cent in the Quarter compared to the comparable 
quarter.&#160; On-mine costs comprise labour, electricity, consumables and other
costs which include security and insurance.&#160; Blanket did not experience 
significant inflationary pressure on input costs.&#160; Approximately 65% of 
Blanket&#8217;s on-mine costs are fixed: as production increases, fixed costs 
are spread over more ounces of production and sales hence the average on-mine 
cost per ounce falls.&#160; Fixed costs and variable cost per tonne mined 
remained broadly unchanged in the Quarter compared to the comparative 
quarter.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">
<hr style="BORDER-BOTTOM: 0px; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BORDER-LEFT: 0px; BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 2in; HEIGHT: 1px; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; 
BORDER-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto; BORDER-RIGHT: 0px" align="left" 
noshade="noshade">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-
size: smaller">6</sup> On mine cost per ounce, all-in sustaining cost per ounce 
and all-in cost per ounce are non-IFRS measures. Refer to Section 10 for a 
reconciliation of these amounts to IFRS</div>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">12</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All-in sustaining 
costs per ounce comprise on-mine costs and also include royalty payments, group 
administrative costs and sustaining costs. The all-in sustaining cost fell by 
9.1 per cent in the Quarter compared to the comparable quarter.&#160; The 
royalty cost per ounce increased due to the higher prevailing gold price; the 
group administrative cost per ounce (excluding the Zambian administration costs 
which were incurred in 2015) fell from $150/ounce to $144/ounce and the 
sustaining capital expenditure cost per ounce fell from $97/ounce&#160; to 
$94/ounce.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All-in costs include 
investment in expansion projects which was higher in the Quarter due to the 
continued investment in Blanket&#8217;s capital projects, which are discussed in
section 4.7 of this MD&amp;A.&#160; Investment in expansion projects in Q2 2016 
was $319/ounce of gold sold compared to $188/ounce in the comparative 
quarter.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">4.7</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Capital 
Projects</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Following completion 
of the No. 6 Winze in the preceding Quarter, the main capital development 
project is the Central Shaft, which </font>is the remaining component of the 
Revised Investment Plan which is discussed in Section 4.9 of this 
MD&amp;A.&#160; The shaft is being sunk in one single phase from surface to 
1,080 meters.&#160; The estimated completion date of the shaft is mid-2018; 
first production from the Central Shaft is expected shortly thereafter as pre-
development in the initial areas to be mined will be effected via the No. 6 
Winze.&#160; During the Quarter a 23-meter high sinking headgear was installed 
and commissioned with all of the facilities required to commence the permanent 
sinking phase of the project i.e. 4 x 10 tonne stage winders and a three-deck 
stage.&#160; Permanent sinking commenced in May 2016 and the shaft is now 170 
metres deep. The main sink will continue down to 1,080 meters below 
surface.&#160; During the main sinking phase, it is anticipated that shaft-
sinking will increase to the target rate of approximately 3 meters per day.<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
Central Shaft remains on track in terms of the timing of completion in mid-2018 
and capital costs. </font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Other capital 
projects include:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z5f485d349cf64623969879cd51b5ad02" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">the installation of a 
conveyor system at the AR South decline from 750 meters to 765 meters, which was
commissioned in early August;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zfdef7c4106324f0281502aeefb89e5d1" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">the extension of the AR 
South decline from 765 meters to 780 meters.&#160; The decline reached the 780 m
level in the Quarter and lateral development has commenced;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z4b1c312cff7b4a3a9d8a8db57a6e307a" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">a second decline development
below 750 meters at the Blanket ore body;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z863d36f8103049eba9be1e886c54c921" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>

ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>

Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">an extraction haulage on 750
meter level at Eroica;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z05479f18587e46de962f647ec0fd59bd" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>

extension:&#160; work on this project was suspended in the Quarter in preference

haulage.&#160; The haulage has a further 130 meters to reach Lima and work is 
expected to resume in the third quarter of 2016; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zce12daad3b3a4a1cba5bbdd14badc8cd" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">Several refurbishment and 
expansion projects have been completed and are in progress at the metallurgical 
plant, as discussed in Section 4.5.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 36pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">4.8</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Indigenisation</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Transactions that 
implemented the Indigenisation of Blanket were completed on September 5, 2012 
following which Caledonia owns 49% of Blanket and has received a Certificate of 
Compliance from the Government of Zimbabwe which confirms that Blanket is fully 
compliant with the <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Indigenisation and Economic Empowerment 
Act.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As a 49% shareholder,
Caledonia receives 49% of Blanket&#8217;s dividends plus the repayment of vendor
facilitation loans which were extended by Blanket to certain of the Indigenous 
Shareholders and which carry interest at LIBOR plus 10%.&#160; The vendor
facilitation loans are repaid by way of dividends from Blanket Mine.&#160; 80% 
of the dividends declared by Blanket Mine which are attributable to the 
beneficiaries of the vendor facilitation loans are used to repay such loans and 
the remaining 20% unconditionally accrues to the respective Indigenous 
Shareholders.&#160; Blanket suspended dividend payments in 2015 until early 
August 2016 in order to fund the capital projects provided under the Revised 
Investment Plan as a result of which the repayment of facilitation loans by 
Blanket&#8217;s indigenous shareholders will also be suspended.&#160; During 
this period, there was a moratorium on the interest roll-up on the outstanding 
facilitation loans.&#160;&#160; The interest moratorium had no effect on either 
Caledonia&#8217;s cash receipts or its reported earnings as interest on the 
facilitation loans is not recognized in Caledonia&#8217;s financial 
statements.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">13</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The average realised 
gold price in 2015 was lower than $1,200 per ounce which was used as the basis 
for planning the funding of the Revised Investment Plan at Blanket.&#160; 
Accordingly, to ensure that Blanket had the financial capacity to implement the 
Revised Investment Plan, in October 2015 Caledonia provided funding of $5m to 
Blanket as an inter-company loan.&#160; As disclosed in the MD&amp;A for the 
preceding quarter, it was envisaged that the inter-company loan would be re-
structured as a rights issue by Blanket in the second quarter of 2016.&#160; As 
a result of the higher gold price and the realisation of the Bills in May 2016, 
Blanket&#8217;s cash position is better than anticipated.&#160; Accordingly, 
Blanket no longer requires an injection of permanent capital and the planned 
rights issue by Blanket has been cancelled.&#160; In July 2016 Blanket repaid 
the intercompany loan due to Caledonia and in early August, Blanket resumed 
dividend payments.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The outstanding 
balance of the facilitation loans as at June 30, 2016 was $31.3 million 
(December 31, 2015, $31.3 million).&#160; As noted above, Blanket had suspended 
dividend payments and a moratorium was placed on interest on the loans until 
dividends are resumed by Blanket Mine.&#160; Accordingly, there was neither any 
capital repayment of the loans nor any accumulation of interest on the loans 
during the Quarter.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Following the 
resumption of dividend payments by Blanket in August 2016, the interest 
moratorium was lifted.&#160; 80% of the dividends paid to the indigenous 
Zimbabwean shareholders who hold 41% of Blanket will be used to pay interest and
make capital repayments on the facilitation loans. The dividends attributable to
GCSOT, which holds 10% of Blanket will be withheld by Blanket to repay the 
advance dividends which were paid to GCSOT in 2012 and 2013 and which had an 
outstanding balance of $3,237,000 as June 30 2016.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The vendor
facilitation loans are not shown as receivables in Caledonia&#8217;s Unaudited 
Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements in terms of the 
International Financial Reporting Standards. These loans are effectively equity 
instruments as their only means of repayment is via dividend distributions from 
Blanket.&#160; Caledonia continues to consolidate Blanket for accounting 
purposes.&#160; Further information on the accounting effects of indigenisation 
at Blanket is set out in Note 5 to the Unaudited Condensed Interim Financial 
Statements and in a Frequently Asked Questions page which is available on 
Caledonia&#8217;s website.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">4.9</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px"
id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Opportunities and 
Outlook</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Revised Investment Plan 
to Increase Production</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On November 3, 2014 
Caledonia announced its Revised Investment Plan and production projections for 
the Blanket Mine. The objectives of the Revised Investment Plan are to improve 
the underground infrastructure and logistics and allow an efficient and 
sustainable production build-up.&#160; The infrastructure improvements include 
the development of a &#8220;Tramming Loop&#8221;, deepening the No.6 Winze and 
sinking a new 6-meter diameter Central Shaft from surface to 1,080 meters. As 
discussed in Section 4.7, implementation of the Revised Investment Plan is 
proceeding on schedule and within budget:&#160; the Tramming Loop and the 
sinking of the No. 6 Winze were both completed slightly ahead of target and work
on the Central Shaft is proceeding according to plan.&#160; In addition to the 
projects that form the Revised Investment Plan, Blanket has also completed a 
decline development into the AR South ore body which is being extended as 
described in Section 4.7 and has commenced work on a second decline development 
below 750 meters at the Blanket ore bodies.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">14</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Revised 
Investment Plan provides for proposed investment of approximately US$50 million 
between 2015 and 2017 and a further US$20 million in the period 2018 to 
2020.&#160; The Revised Investment Plan includes a revised life of mine plan for
the Blanket Mine (the &#8220;LOM Plan&#8221;) in terms of which it is 
anticipated that the approximate production from existing proven and probable 
mineral reserves above 750 m Level will be as set out below.</div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="z6068068645f44986b630fbc0f6050353" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">

</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 9.97%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: middle; 
BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2px solid">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">600</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2px solid; 
BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 30.26%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: middle">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gold production (koz)</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 
9.96%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: middle">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">0</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 
9.96%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: middle">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">4-5</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH:

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">70-75</div>
</td>

</table>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Canadian regulations 
do not allow planned production from inferred resources to be added to those 
from proven and probable reserves for disclosure purposes.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There is no certainty
that the PEA will be realised. The updated Technical Report was authored by Daan
van Heerden, Uwe Englemann, Dario Clemente, Johan Odendaal and Jaco Burger of 
Minxcon (Pty) Ltd., each of whom is a qualified person who is independent of 
Caledonia for the purposes of National Instrument 43-101. &#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Exploration</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia intends to 
continue its exploration efforts at the Blanket Mine as discussed in Section 5.1
of the MD&amp;A; further exploration at the first two of Blanket&#8217;s 
portfolio of satellite properties (Mascot and GG) continued as discussed in 
Section 5.2&#160;&#160; No production forecasts are currently attributed to 
either GG or Mascot. Further information on Blanket&#8217;s exploration is set 
out in Section 5 of this MD&amp;A.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Strategy</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia&#8217;s 
strategic focus is on implementing the Revised Investment Plan at Blanket on 
schedule and within budget.&#160; Caledonia&#8217;s board and management believe
the successful implementation of the Revised Investment Plan remains in the best
interests of all stakeholders because it is expected to result in increased 
production, reduced operating costs and greater flexibility to undertake further
exploration and development, thereby safeguarding and enhancing Blanket&#8217;s 
long term future.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia&#8217;s 
cash generation is expected to improve as production increases in terms of the 
Revised Investment Plan.&#160; Caledonia will consider additional investment 
opportunities where it can invest the cash generated by Blanket.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">5</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXPLORATION AND 
PROJECT DEVELOPMENT</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia&#8217;s 
exploration activities are focussed on Blanket Mine and its satellite 
properties.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">5.1</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Blanket 
Exploration</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The deep drilling 
program continues to confirm economic mineralisation at the AR South and Blanket
ore zones to a depth of 1,300 meters and at the Eroica south shoot to a depth of
900 meters.&#160; 6,106 diamond drill meters were achieved in the Quarter 
compared to a plan of 4,500 meters and an average quarterly rate of 
approximately 3,500 meters in 2015.&#160; The increased drilling rate is due to 
the commissioning of new machines in the first six months of 2016. .</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On July 28, 2016 
Caledonia released a resource update based on the drilling over the previous six
months. 343,000 tonnes were upgraded from the Inferred to the Indicated Resource
category and an additional 1,276,000 tonnes of new inventory has been added to 
Inferred Resources.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">15</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This upgraded 
Indicated Resource of 343,000 tonnes, combined with the resources upgraded 
during 2015 increased the quantum of reserves and indicated resources that may 
be used in the life of mine plan from 2,934,000 tonnes used for the Technical 
Report prepared by Minxcon in December 2014, to 4,889,000 tonnes currently and 
represents an increase of 67% per cent in terms of mineable tonnes and hence in 
the life of the mine.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>

inferred resources in the Blanket section doubles the quantum previously 
estimated from this section of the mine.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia has a 
conservative approach to accruing new resources: only resource blocks with an 
estimated grade in excess of the current pay limit are taken into 
inventory.&#160; Resources that are below the pay limit are reviewed on an 
annual basis.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">5.2</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Blanket Satellite 
Prospects</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Blanket Mine has 
exploration title holdings in the form of registered mining claims in the Gwanda
Greenstone Belt totalling 78 claims, including a small number under option, 
covering properties with a total area of about 2,500 hectares. Included within 
these claim areas are 18 previously operated small gold workings which warrant 
further exploration, i.e. the Satellite Projects.&#160; Blanket&#8217;s main 
exploration efforts on these satellite properties are focused at this stage on 
the GG Project and the Mascot Project Area which, based on past production 
records, are likely to have the greatest potential.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">GG
Project</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The GG Project is 
located approximately seven kilometers&#160;southeast of Blanket Mine.&#160; 
Surface drilling programs have been carried out at the GG Project over the past 
eight years consisting of 24 diamond-cored holes totalling 6,360 meters of 
drilling.&#160; Two zones of gold mineralization have been established down to a
depth of at least 300 meters, each with a potential strike length of up to 150 
meters. Current activities involve the definition of the extent and 
characteristics of this mineralization by way of a prospect shaft and level 
development.&#160; Limited work took place during the Quarter and further work 
will be suspended pending the outcome of metallurgical studies so that resources
can be released to focus on exploration and development at Blanket Mine.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">16</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px;
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Mascot Project Area</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Mascot Project 
Area includes three sections - the Mascot prospect, the Penzance prospect and 
the Eagle Vulture prospect.&#160; Mascot was previously mined to a depth of 
approximately 250 meters, exploiting an east-west trending mineralised body the 
strike extent of which decreased at depth but which was accompanied by a 
doubling in width.&#160; Previous surface drilling undertaken by Blanket has 
indicated the existence of two further mineralised zones, one to the north and 
one to the south of the mined out area.&#160; Development at Mascot in the 
Quarter was restricted to a single machine crew which completed the blocking 
exercise in the North parallel zone.&#160; Further work will be suspended 
pending the outcome of further metallurgical studies so that resources can be 
released to focus on exploration and development at Blanket Mine.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z3748b5bb4e184a969810e4b28110c2de" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 21.3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All further 
investment at Blanket is expected to be funded from Blanket&#8217;s internal 
cash flows and its Zimbabwean borrowing facilities.&#160; No further investment 
will take place at the Nama project in Zambia following the termination of all 
of Caledonia&#8217;s presence in Zambia during 2015.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

<td style="WIDTH: 21.3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">FINANCING</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia financed 
all its operations using funds on hand and those generated by its 
operations.&#160; No equity financing took place in the Quarter and none is 
currently planned.&#160; Blanket has an unsecured $5 million loan facility in 
Zimbabwe which is repayable on demand.&#160; At June 30, 2016 the facility was 
undrawn.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>

Caledonia&#8217;s net cash, the overdraft and working capital and an analysis of
the sources and uses of Caledonia&#8217;s cash are discussed in Section 3 of 
this MD&amp;A.&#160; The overdraft facility is held by Blanket with a Zimbabwean
Bank and is unsecured and repayable on demand.&#160; The Company&#8217;s liquid 
assets as at June 30, 2016 exceed its planned and foreseeable commitments as set
out in Section 9 of this MD&amp;A.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 21.3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">9.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">OFF-
BALANCE SHEET ARRANGEMENTS, CONTRACTUAL COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There are no off balance 
sheet arrangements apart from the facilitation loans of $33.6&#160;million which
are not reflected as loans receivable for IFRS purposes (refer to Note 5 of the 
Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial&#160; Statements).&#160; The 
company has the following contractual obligations at June 30, 2016.</div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="zfa4921fab6714075857f2cf8ac68eeaa" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2px solid; WIDTH: 34.16%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
bottom; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2px solid">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Payments due by Period</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">($&#8217;000&#8217;s)</div>

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In addition to the committed purchase obligations set out 
above, Blanket currently intends to invest approximately $24.8 million between 
July 2016 and December 2017 which is not yet committed and a further $8 million 
in the years 2018 to 2020, which is also uncommitted.&#160; The committed and 
uncommitted investment will be used to maintain Blanket&#8217;s existing 
operations and implement the Revised Investment Plan which are discussed in 
Sections 4.7 and 4.9 of this MD&amp;A.&#160; Committed and uncommitted purchase 
obligations will be met from the cash generated from Blanket&#8217;s existing 
operations and Blanket&#8217;s existing borrowing facility.&#160; Caledonia has 
no obligations in respect of capital or operating leases. As of June 30, 2016, 
Caledonia had potential liabilities for rehabilitation work on the Blanket and 
Eersteling Mines<sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-size:
smaller">7</sup> &#8211; if and when those mines are permanently closed &#8211; 
at an estimated discounted cost of $2,798,000.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z1520f44c90db466ba4d9a1078e1896e4" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">10.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NON-IFRS 
MEASURES</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Throughout this document, we have provided
measures prepared in accordance with IFRS in addition to some non-IFRS 
performance measures for investors who use them to evaluate our 
performance.&#160; Since there is no standard method for calculating non-IFRS 
measures, they are not a reliable way to compare Caledonia against other 
companies.&#160; Non-IFRS measures should be used along with other performance 
measures prepared in accordance with IFRS.&#160; We have defined below the non-
IFRS measures we have used in this document and provide a reconciliation of such
non-IFRS measures to the IFRS measures we report.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">10.1</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Cost per 
ounce</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Non-IFRS performance 
measures such as &#8220;On-Mine Cost per ounce&#8221;, &#8220;All-in Sustaining 
Cost per ounce&#8221; and &#8220;All-in Cost per ounce&#8221; are used in this 
document.&#160; Management believes these measures assist investors and other 
stakeholders in understanding the economics of gold mining over the life-cycle 
of a mine.&#160; These measures are calculated on the basis set out by the World
Gold Council in a Guidance Note published on June 23, 2013 and accordingly 
differ from the previous basis of calculation.&#160; The table below reconciles 
&#8220;On-mine Cost per ounce&#8221;, &#8220;All-in Sustaining Costs per 
ounce&#8221; and &#8220;All-in Cost per ounce&#8221; to the production costs 
shown in the financial statements which have been prepared under IFRS.<br>
<br>
 _____________________________</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><sup style="vertical-align: text-top; line-height: 1; font-
size: smaller">7</sup> Eersteling Mine is a South African gold property, which 
has been held on care and maintenance for several years.</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">10.2</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Average realised 
gold price per ounce</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#8220;Average 
realised price per ounce&#8221; is a non-IFRS measure which, in conjunction with
the cost per ounce measures described above, allows stakeholders to assess our 
performance.&#160; The table below reconciles &#8220;Average realised price per 
ounce&#8221; to the Revenue shown in the financial statements which have been 
prepared under IFRS.</div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z1bdbe1fd44604af08358721128644c50" cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0">

#000000 2px solid" valign="bottom" colspan="16">

FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Reconciliation of Average Realised Gold 
Price per Ounce</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">($&#8217;000&#8217;s unless otherwise

</td>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">10.3</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Adjusted earnings
per share</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#8220;Adjusted 
earnings per share&#8221; is a non-IFRS measure<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>which
management believes assists investors in understanding the company&#8217;s 
underlying performance. The table below reconciles &#8220;adjusted earnings per 
share&#8221; to the Profit/Loss attributable to Owners of the Company shown in 
the financial statements which have been prepared under IFRS.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">19</font></div>

#cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">6.1</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR:
#cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" 
nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 
1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR:
#cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-
COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">
<div style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">4.1</div>
</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR:
#cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom" 
nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 
1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR:
#cceeff; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" valign="bottom">&#160;</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-

</td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left; BACKGROUND-COLOR:

valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap">&#160;</td>
