</table>
<div><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z87ef94f3a42647f3b3eb6ce550749213" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">11.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">RELATED 
PARTY TRANSACTIONS</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There were no related party transactions 
in the Quarter.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z967b6dda04f14a28b034e6b12887d687" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">12.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CRITICAL 
ACCOUNTING POLICIES</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia's 
accounting policies are set out in the Audited Consolidated Financial Statements
for the year ended December 31, 2015 (the Audited Consolidated Financial 
Statements&#8221;) which have been publicly filed on SEDAR at <font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">www.sedar.com</font>. 
In preparing the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements, 
management is required to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts
represented in the Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements
and related disclosures. Use of available information and the application of 
judgement are inherent in the formation of estimates. Estimates and underlying 
assumptions are reviewed on an on-going basis. Revisions to accounting estimates
are recognised in the period in which the estimates are revised and in any 
future periods affected.&#160; Discussion of recently issued accounting
pronouncements is set out in note 4(p) of the Audited Consolidated Financial 
Statements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Information about 
critical judgements in applying accounting policies that have the most 
significant effect on the amounts recognised in the Unaudited Condensed 
Consolidated Interim Financial Statements is included in the following 
notes:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; MARGIN-
LEFT: 4.5pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">i)</font><font style="WIDTH: 31.5pt; DISPLAY: 
inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">Indigenisation transaction</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The directors of CHZ,
a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company, performed an assessment, using the 
requirements of IFRS 10: <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Consolidated Financial 
Statements</font> (IFRS 10), and concluded that CHZ should continue to 
consolidate Blanket Mine and accounted for the transaction as follows:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z04904d484ddf4169a2857df0ecec9f3c" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">Non-controlling interests 
(&#8220;NCI&#8221;) are recognised on the portion of shareholding upon which 
dividends declared by Blanket Mine accrue unconditionally to equity holders as 
follows:</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z4fdad5e8bbab402581e7ccf75a23d444" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(a)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">20% of the 16%&#160; 
shareholding of NIEEF;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z286105fb1f314cd097886fc82e98a3b7" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(b)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">20% of the 15%&#160; 
shareholding of Fremiro;</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z5702226aec8d475d8dff8c749b29a211" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(c)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">100% of the 10% shareholding
of the Community Trust.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="ze405f7f7226d4a0c964addc5dd39c142" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">This effectively means that 
NCI is recognised at Blanket Mine level at 16.2% of the net assets.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z28837955ef2c4c2896c3ab289cd2b427" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 17pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">The remaining 80% of the 
shareholding of NIEEF and Fremiro is recognised as non-controlling interests to 
the extent that their attributable share of the net asset value of Blanket Mine 
exceeds the balance on the facilitation loans including interest. At June 30, 
2016 the attributable net asset value did not exceed the balance on the 
respective loan accounts and thus no additional NCI was recognised.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">20</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The transaction with 
BETS is accounted for in accordance with IAS 19 <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic;
FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Employee 
Benefits</font> (profit sharing arrangement) as the ownership of the shares does
not ultimately pass to the employees. The employees are entitled to participate 
in 20% of the dividends accruing to the 10% shareholding in Blanket Mine if they
are employed at the date of such distribution. To the extent that 80% of the 
attributable dividends exceed the balance on the BETS facilitation loan they 
will accrue to the employees at the date of such declaration.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Employee Trust 
and BETS are structured entities which are effectively controlled and 
consolidated by Blanket Mine. Accordingly the shares held by BETS are 
effectively treated as treasury shares in Blanket Mine and no NCI is 
recognised.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">ii)</font><font style="WIDTH: 31.5pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 
1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Site restoration 
provisions</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The site restoration 
provision has been calculated for the Blanket Mine based on an independent 
analysis of the rehabilitation costs as performed in 2015 and based on the 
internal assessment for Eersteling Gold Mining Corporation Limited. Estimates 
and assumptions are made when determining the inflationary effect on current 
restoration costs and the discount rate to be applied in arriving at the present
value of the provision. Assumptions, based on the current economic environment, 
have been made which management believes are a reasonable basis upon which to 
estimate the future liability. These estimates take into account any material 
changes to the assumptions that occur when reviewed by management. Estimates are
reviewed annually and are based on current regulatory requirements. Significant 
changes in estimates of contamination, restoration standards and techniques will
result in changes to provisions from period to period. Actual rehabilitation 
costs will ultimately depend on future market prices for the rehabilitation 
costs which will reflect the market condition at the time the rehabilitation 
costs are actually incurred.&#160; The final cost of the currently recognized 
site rehabilitation provisions may be higher or lower than currently provided 
for.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zbd34ce7a33a4471896e12dbef041a939" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">(ii)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Functional and change in presentation currency</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Effective December 
31, 2015, Caledonia Mining Corporation changed its presentation currency in the 
consolidated financial statements from the Canadian dollar to the United States 
dollar (&#8220;US dollar&#8221;). The change in presentation currency was made 
to better reflect the Group's business activities and to improve investor 
ability to compare the Group's financial results with other publicly traded 
businesses in the industry.&#160; In making the change to a US dollar 
presentation currency, the Group applied the change retrospectively<font 
style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font>as if the new presentation currency had always been the
Group's presentation currency. The change in presentation currency was applied 
retrospectively up to January 1, 2010, which was the date of initial adoption of
IFRS by the Group.&#160; Equity was translated at the exchange rate at January 
1, 2010, except for the foreign currency translation reserve which was reset to 
zero and with the balance recognised in retained earnings, in accordance with 
IFRS 1: <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">First-time Adoption of International Financial Reporting
Standards</font>. The financial statements for all the periods presented have 
been translated to a US dollar presentation currency.&#160; For comparative 
balances, assets and liabilities was translated into the presentation currency 
at the rate of exchange prevailing at the reporting date for those periods, 
income and expenses was translated into the presentation currency using the 
exchange rate at the date of transaction or using a reasonable average exchange 
rate that approximates the exchange rates at the dates of the transactions in 
accordance with IAS 21: <font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Effects of Changes in Foreign 
Exchange Rates</font>. Exchange rate differences arising on translation to the 
presentation currency were recognised in the foreign currency translation 
reserve in shareholders' equity.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">21</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z859812457feb4c9492bee44710d951df" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">iv)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Exploration and evaluation (&#8220;E&amp;E&#8221;) expenditure</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The application of 
Caledonia&#8217;s accounting policy for exploration and evaluation expenditures 
requires judgements when determining which expenditures are recognised as
exploration and evaluation assets (&#8220;E&amp;E properties&#8221;).</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia also makes 
estimates and assumptions regarding the possible impairment of E&amp;E 
properties by evaluating whether it is likely that future economic benefits will
flow to Caledonia, which may be based on assumptions about future events or 
circumstances. Estimates and assumptions made may change if new information 
becomes available. If information becomes available suggesting that the recovery
of expenditures is unlikely, the amount capitalized is written off in profit or 
loss in the period the new information becomes available.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The recoverability of
the carrying amount of the South African mineral properties (if not impaired) is
dependent upon the availability of sufficient funding to bring the properties 
into commercial production, the price of the products to be recovered, the 
exchange rate of the local currency relative to the currency of funding and the 
undertaking of profitable mining operations. As a result of these uncertainties,
the actual amount recovered may vary significantly from the carrying 
amount.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">v)</font><font style="WIDTH: 31.5pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 
1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Income 
taxes</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Significant estimates
and assumptions are required in determining the provision for income taxes. 
There are many transactions and calculations undertaken during the ordinary 
course of business for which the ultimate tax determination is uncertain. 
Caledonia records its best estimate of the tax liability including the related 
interest and penalties in the current tax provision. Management believes they 
have adequately provided for the probable outcome of these matters; however, the
final outcome may result in a materially different outcome than the amount 
included in the tax liabilities.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In addition, 
Caledonia applies judgement in recognizing deferred tax assets relating to tax 
losses carried forward to the extent that there are sufficient taxable temporary
differences (deferred tax liabilities) relating to the same taxation authority 
and the same taxable entity against which the unused tax losses can be utilized 
or sufficient estimated taxable income against which the losses can be utilized.
However, utilization of the tax losses also depends on the ability of the 
taxable entity to satisfy certain tests at the time the losses are 
recouped.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">vi)</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Share-based 
payment expense</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The fair value of the
amount payable to employees in respect of share based awards, which are settled 
in cash, is recognised as an expense with a corresponding increase in 
liabilities, over the period over which the employee becomes unconditionally
entitled to payment. The liability is re-measured at each reporting date. Any 
changes in the fair value of the liability are recognised as a personnel expense
in profit or loss.&#160; Additional information about significant judgements and
estimates and the assumptions used to estimate fair value for cash settled 
share-based payment transactions are disclosed in note 8<font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"> to the 
</font>Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">vii)</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-SIZE: 
1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Impairment</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At each reporting 
date, Caledonia determines if impairment indicators exist, and if present, 
performs an impairment review of the non-financial assets held in Caledonia. The
exercise is subject to various judgemental decisions and estimates. Financial 
assets are also reviewed regularly for impairment.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z7d96fcc57cdd4f83a0c3d96eff10d28c" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">13.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">FINANCIAL
INSTRUMENTS</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; TEXT-INDENT: -4.3pt; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 4.3pt;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Commodity risk</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia is exposed 
to fluctuations in the price of gold because Blanket produces and sells gold 
dor&#233; and receives the prevailing spot price for the gold contained 
therein.&#160; In light of the volatility in the gold price, Blanket&#8217;s 
continued investment in the Revised Investment Plan and Caledonia&#8217;s 
divided policy, in February 2016 Caledonia entered into a financial transaction 
in respect of 15,000 ounces of gold over a 6 month period which provided 
Caledonia with a guaranteed minimum gold price of $1,050 per ounce on the hedged
ounces (the &#8220;Collar&#8221; price) and full price participation if the gold
price is above $1,079 per once (the &#8220;Cap&#8221; price). The maximum cost 
to Caledonia of this transaction was $435,000 being 15,000 ounces at 
$29/oz.&#160; Blanket continued to sell all of its production to Fidelity on the
same terms as prevailed previously i.e. it will continue to receive the spot 
price of gold less a 1.25% &#8220;early settlement&#8221; discount.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Credit risk</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The carrying amount 
of financial assets as disclosed in the statements of financial position and 
related notes represents the maximum credit exposure. The trade receivable 
relates to gold bullion sold before quarter end. The amount was settled in July 
2016.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">22</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Impairment losses</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">None of the trade and
other receivables is past due at the period-end date.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Liquidity risk</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All trade payables 
and bank overdraft have maturity dates that are expected to mature in under 6 
months.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Currency risk</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A small proportion of
Caledonia&#8217;s assets, financial instruments and transactions are denominated
in currencies other than the United States Dollar. The financial results and 
financial position of Caledonia are reported in United States dollars in the 
Audited Condensed Consolidated Interim Financial Statements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The fluctuation of 
the United States dollar in relation to other currencies will consequently have 
an impact upon the profitability of Caledonia and may also affect the value of 
Caledonia&#8217;s assets and liabilities and the amount of shareholders&#8217; 
equity.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia has certain 
financial assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies. Caledonia 
does not use any derivative instruments to reduce its foreign currency risks. 
</font>To reduce exposure to currency transaction risk, Caledonia maintains cash
and cash equivalents in the currencies used by Caledonia to meet short<font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#8208;</font>term liquidity requirements.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Interest rate risk</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Interest rate risk is
the risk borne by an interest-bearing asset or liability as a result of 
fluctuations in interest rates. Unless otherwise noted, it is the opinion of 
management that Caledonia is not exposed to significant interest rate risk as it
has no debt financing apart from short term borrowings utilized in 
Zimbabwe.&#160; Caledonia&#8217;s cash and cash equivalents include highly 
liquid investments that earn interest at market rates. Caledonia manages its 
interest rate risk by endeavouring to maximize the interest income earned on 
excess funds while maintaining the liquidity necessary to conduct operations on 
a day-to-day basis. Caledonia&#8217;s policy focuses on preservation of capital 
and limits the investing of excess funds to liquid term deposits in high credit 
quality financial institutions.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z4bcfeb099c2a4cf4be7ee408b0f80cda" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">14.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">DIVIDEND 
POLICY AND OTHER SHAREHOLDER INFORMATION</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia paid its 
inaugural dividend of 5 Canadian cents per share in February 2013 following a 
capital re-structure which was approved by shareholders in January 2013 which 
allowed it to make dividend payments.&#160; The inaugural dividend did not 
relate to any specific accounting period.&#160; Caledonia paid a further 
dividend of 5 Canadian cents per share in April 2013 in respect of the earnings 
for the year to December 31, 2012.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
4.3pt">On November 25, 2013 Caledonia announced a revised dividend policy 
pursuant to which it intended to pay a dividend of 6 Canadian cents per share in
2014, split into 4 equal quarterly payments of 1.5 Canadian cents per 
share.&#160; The first quarterly dividend was paid on January 31, 2014; further 
payments were made quarterly thereafter.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
4.3pt">Following the announcement on December 16, 2015 that henceforth Caledonia
will report its financial results in United States Dollars, the quarterly 
dividend that was paid at the end of January 2016 was declared and denominated 
in United States Dollars as 1.125 United States cents.&#160;&#160; A further 
quarterly dividend of 1.125 United States cents was paid at the end of April 
2016.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
4.3pt">On July 5, 2016 Caledonia announced a quarterly dividend of 1.375 United
States cents per share, or 5.5 United States cents per annum.&#160; The 
increased dividend represents Caledonia&#8217;s revised dividend policy.&#160; 
It is currently envisaged that the dividend of 5.5 United States cents per annum
will be maintained in 2016.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">23</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z901d64a3695e4ba3b22f7588f7b5a759" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">15.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">DIRECTORS
AND MANAGEMENT</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On July 26, 2016 
Caledonia announced that John McGloin had joined the Board as an independent 
non-executive director and that Caledonia had also appointed Maurice Mason as 
Vice President, Investor Relations and Corporate Development.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mr McGloin holds an 
MSc in Mining and Exploration Geology from the Camborne School of Mines and a 
BSc in Geology from the National University of Ireland, Galway.&#160; After he 
graduated, Mr McGloin worked as a geologist and a consultant geologist where he 
gained experience of a range of projects and multiple jurisdictions.&#160; 
Following this, he spent 10 years working in the City of London, initially as a 
mining analyst and latterly as head of the mining teams at various London-based 
stockbrokers.&#160; From April 2012 to April 2016, Mr McGloin was Executive 
Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Amara Mining PLC (&#8220;Amara&#8221;), 
which was focused on the Yaoure gold project in Cote d&#8217;Ivoire in West 
Africa.&#160; In April 2016, Amara was subject to a recommended combination with
Perseus Mining Limited (&#8220;Perseus&#8221;), an Australian mining group which
is listed on the Toronto and Australian stock exchanges and operates gold mines 
in West Africa.&#160;&#160; Following the combination between Perseus and Amara,
Mr McGloin joined the board of Perseus as a non-executive director, a role which
he intends to combine with his role at Caledonia.&#160; In addition to his 
recent and relevant experience as an executive in the mining industry, Mr 
McGloin&#8217;s appointment will support Caledonia&#8217;s increased focus on 
exploration and resource development and will enhance Caledonia&#8217;s access 
to institutional investors.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mr Maurice Mason is a
dual South African and UK national, resident in London, who holds a BSc in 
Engineering from the University of Natal, South Africa and an MBA from Henley 
Management College.&#160; Mr Mason&#8217;s career includes positions at 
Unilever, SABMiller and Anglo American.&#160; Most recently, Mr Mason was 
director, Equity Research, for Stifel Nicolaus Europe Ltd covering mining 
companies listed in the UK.&#160; Mr Mason will take over the day-to-day 
responsibility for Investor Relations and Corporate Development from Mr 
Learmonth, who, since November 2014 had combined this role with that of Chief 
Financial Officer.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;In May 2016 
Paul Mathews joined the management team as Mineral Resource Manager and is based
at the Blanket Mine in Zimbabwe.&#160; Paul obtained a BSc (Hons) Geology degree
at The University of Southampton, United Kingdom in 1980. He has twenty five 
years broad-based experience in the mineral exploration and mining industry in 
Africa, Australasia and East Asia ranging from grass roots exploration to 
resource definition drilling and mining.&#160; Over the last 14 years his 
experience has been weighted towards GIS and database management, 3D geological 
modelling, resource evaluation and project management.&#160; He will be 
responsible for mineral resource management, mine planning and 
exploration.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Subsequent to the 
appointment of Paul Mathews, Dr. Trevor Pearton has stepped down as VP 
Exploration on a permanent basis and he will provide consulting services to 
Caledonia in the future.&#160; Management thank Trevor for his contribution over
the past 10 years and look forward to working with him on specific projects as a
consultant.&#160; Dr Pearton will remain the Qualified Person (QP) for Caledonia
for the remainder of 2016 after which Paul Mathews will take over as QP during 
2017.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt">

</div>

at August 11, 2016, outstanding options to purchase Common Shares 
(&#8220;Options&#8221;) are as follows:</div>

<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">24</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px;

</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia&#8217;s 
Omnibus Equity Incentive Compensation Plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;) allows that 
the number of shares reserved for issuance <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">under the Plan, together with Shares 
reserved for issue under any other share compensation arrangements of the 
Company, shall not exceed the number which represents 10% of the issued and 
</font>outstanding Shares from time to time. Accordingly, Caledonia could grant 
Options on a further 4,389,171 shares at August 11, 2016.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z255be2aa33d84d2bbccd15a1257e6bb9" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">17.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">RISK 
ANALYSIS</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The business of 
Caledonia contains significant risk due to the nature of mining, exploration and
development activities.&#160; Risks such as interest rate, foreign exchange and 
credit risks are considered in Notes 6 and 24 to the Audited Consolidated 
Financial Statements.&#160; Caledonia&#8217;s business contains significant
additional risks due to the jurisdictions in which it operates and the nature of
mining, exploration and development.&#160; Included in the risk factors below 
are details of how management seeks to mitigate the risks where this is 
possible.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z92c7e29b52a84150983a0c9c62321454" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 6px"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 22px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Liquidity 
risk:</font>&#160; The Company needs to generate capital to be able to continue 
to invest in properties and projects without raising third party 
financing.&#160; Caledonia currently has sufficient cash resources and continues
to generate sufficient cash to cover all of its anticipated investment 
needs.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z61b14194741e4248a157714a7d12990e" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 5px"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 23px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Exploration
Risk</font>:&#160;&#160; The Company needs to identify new resources to replace 
ore which has been depleted by mining activities and to commence new 
projects.&#160; Blanket has embarked on development and exploration programmes 
as set out in sections 4.7 and 5.&#160; No assurance can be given that 
exploration will be successful in identifying sufficient mineral resources of an
adequate grade and suitable metallurgical characteristics that are suitable for 
further development or production.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z7b0b03d3bfb04190a67a66b5853a712d" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 5px"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 23px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Development
Risk</font>:&#160; The Company is engaged in development activities at Blanket 
Mine and the Satellite properties including the implementation of the Revised 
Plan as set out in section 4.9 of the MD&amp;A.&#160; Construction and 
development of projects are subject to numerous risks including:&#160; obtaining
equipment, permits and services; changes in regulations, currency rate changes; 
labour shortages; fluctuations in metal prices and the loss of community
support.&#160; There can be no assurance that construction will commence or 
continue in accordance with the current expectations or at all.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z4241c68c307444c895b2f78594682483" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 5px"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 25px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Production 
Estimates</font>:&#160; Estimates for future production are based on mining 
plans and are subject to change.&#160; Production estimates are subject to risk 
and no assurance can be given that future production estimates will be 
achieved.&#160; Actual production may vary from estimated production for a 
variety of reasons including un-anticipated variations in grades, mined tonnages
and geological conditions, accident and equipment breakdown, changes in metal 
prices and the cost and supply of inputs and changes to government 
regulations.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z0d10ffefb14d4350848a940b22832af2" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 5.7pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 16.8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Mineral 
Rights:</font>&#160; The Company&#8217;s existing licences and permits are in 
good standing.&#160; The Company has to pay fees etc. to maintain its rights and
licence.&#160; No assurance can be given that the Company will be able to make 
payments by the required date or will meet development and production schedules 
that are required to protect licences.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z88aaa67a008b436fbc2fbd018b654ff0" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 5.7pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 16.8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Metal 
Prices:&#160; </font>The Company&#8217;s operations and exploration and 
development projects are heavily influenced by the price of gold, which is 
particularly subject to fluctuation.&#160; Following the expiry of the hedging 
transaction in July 2016, Caledonia has no strategy to limit the effect of
adverse gold price movements.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z5ace0f32b39e4ad18eadf8bf37fc1235" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 5.7pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 16.8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Increasing 
input costs</font>:&#160; Mining companies generally have experienced higher 
costs of steel, reagents, labour and electricity and from local and national 
government for levies, fees, royalties and other direct and indirect 
taxes.&#160; Blanket&#8217;s planned growth should allow the fixed cost 
component to be absorbed over increased production, thereby helping to alleviate
somewhat the effect of any further price increases.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z0ffa6e60062f4395aa78c5e559eafad0" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 7px"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 21px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Illegal 
mining</font>: There has been an increase in illegal mining activities on 
properties controlled by Blanket.&#160; This gives rise to increased security 
costs and an increased risk of theft and damage to equipment.&#160; Blanket has 
received adequate support and assistance from the Zimbabwean police in 
investigating such cases.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">25</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
3pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zf5f56e6dd3c448c09c333373ec5db93c" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 5px">
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 23px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Electricity
supply</font>: Zimbabwe produces and imports less electricity than it requires 
and has insufficient funds to adequately maintain or upgrade its distribution 
infrastructure.&#160; This has historically resulted in frequent interruptions 
to the power supply at Blanket Mine.&#160; Blanket has addressed the issue of 
interrupted power supply by installing stand-by generators and by entering into 
an un-interrupted power supply arrangement with the state-owned electricity 
company in return for paying a premium tariff.&#160; The un-interrupted power 
supply arrangement and the stand-by generators do not cover the GG and Mascot 
exploration properties</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z5e408d5efe23400588d16148c0bbd142" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 6px"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 22px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Succession 
planning</font>:&#160; The limited availability of mining and other technical 
skills and experience in Zimbabwe and the difficulty of attracting appropriately
skilled employees to Zimbabwe creates a risk that appropriate skills may not be 
available if, for whatever reason, the current skills base at the Blanket Mine 
is depleted.&#160; The Caledonia and Blanket management teams have been 
augmented so that, if required, it could provide appropriate support to 
Blanket.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z6513173c4d6d4d309f128db9d600cec2" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 6px"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 22px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Country 
risk</font>: The commercial environment in which the Company operates is 
unpredictable.&#160; Potential risks may arise from: unforeseen changes in the 
legal and regulatory framework which means that laws may change, may not be
enforced, or judgements may not be upheld; restrictions on the movement of 
currency and the availability of exchange to make payments from Zimbabwe; risks 
relating to possible corruption, bribery, civil disorder, expropriation or 
nationalisation; risks relating to restrictions on access to assets.&#160; 
Management believes that it has minimised such risks by complying fully with all
relevant legislation and by obtaining all relevant regulatory permissions and 
approvals.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z57ed8f8d105347178866ade7a5eba07c" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 6px"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 22px; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: top; align: right">&#183;</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Gold 
marketing arrangements: </font>In terms of regulations introduced by the 
Zimbabwean Ministry of Finance in January 2014, all gold produced in Zimbabwe 
must be sold to Fidelity, a company which is controlled by the Zimbabwean 
authorities.&#160; Accordingly, all of Blanket&#8217;s production has been sold 
to Fidelity.&#160; Blanket has received all payments due from Fidelity in full 
and on time.&#160; However the requirement to sell to Fidelity increases 
Blanket&#8217;s credit risk<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font>because Fidelity has failed to pay Blanket 
in the past.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z83ccae19f8f0431facaf8b85c6241bb2" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 3.3pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 32.7pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">18.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">FORWARD 
LOOKING STATEMENTS</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Information and 
statements contained in this MD&amp;A that are not historical facts are 
&#8220;forward-looking information&#8221; within the meaning of applicable 
securities legislation that involve risks and uncertainties relating, but not 
limited to, Caledonia&#8217;s current expectations, intentions, plans, and 
beliefs.&#160; Forward-looking information can often be identified by forward-
looking words such as &#8220;anticipate&#8221;, &#8220;believe&#8221;, 
&#8220;expect&#8221;, &#8220;goal&#8221;, &#8220;plan&#8221;, 
&#8220;target&#8221;, &#8220;intend&#8221;, &#8220;estimate&#8221;, 
&#8220;could&#8221;, &#8220;should&#8221;, &#8220;may&#8221; and
&#8220;will&#8221; or the negative of these terms or similar words suggesting 
future outcomes, or other expectations, beliefs, plans, objectives, assumptions,
intentions or statements about future events or performance.&#160; Examples of 
forward-looking information in this MD&amp;A include: implementation schedules 
for, and other uncertainties inherent in, the Revised Plan; costs associated 
with the LOM Plan; production guidance; estimates of future/targeted production 
rates; planned mill capacity increases; estimates of future metallurgical 
recovery rates and the ability to maintain high metallurgical recovery rates; 
timing of commencement of operations; plans and timing regarding further 
exploration, drilling and development; the prospective nature of exploration and
development targets; the ability to upgrade and convert mineral resources to 
mineral reserves; capital costs; our intentions with respect to financial 
position and third party financing; and future dividend payments.&#160; This 
forward-looking information is based, in part, on assumptions and factors that 
may change or prove to be incorrect, thus causing actual results, performance or
achievements to be materially different from those expressed or implied by 
forward-looking information.&#160; Such factors and assumptions include, but are
not limited to: failure to establish estimated resources and reserves, the grade
and recovery of ore which is mined varying from estimates, success of future 
exploration and drilling programs, reliability of drilling, sampling and assay 
data, assumptions regarding the representativeness of mineralization being 
inaccurate, success of planned metallurgical test-work, capital and operating 
costs varying significantly from estimates, delays in obtaining or failures to 
obtain required governmental, environmental or other project approvals, changes 
in government regulations, legislation and rates of taxation, inflation, changes
in exchange rates, fluctuations in commodity prices, delays in the development 
of projects and other factors.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">26</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Potential 
shareholders and prospective investors should be aware that these statements are
subject to known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that could 
cause actual results to differ materially from those suggested by the forward-
looking statements.&#160; Such factors include, but are not limited to: risks 
relating to estimates of mineral reserves and mineral resources proving to be 
inaccurate, fluctuations in gold price and payment terms for gold sold to 
Fidelity, risks and hazards associated with the business of mineral exploration,
development and mining (including environmental hazards, industrial accidents, 
unusual or unexpected geological or structural formations, pressures, power 
outages, explosions, landslides, cave-ins and flooding), risks relating to the 
credit worthiness or financial condition of suppliers, refiners and other 
parties with whom the Company does business; inadequate insurance, or inability 
to obtain insurance, to cover these risks and hazards, employee relations; 
relationships with and claims by local communities and indigenous populations; 
political risk; availability and increasing costs associated with mining inputs 
and labour; the speculative nature of mineral exploration and development, 
including the risks of obtaining or maintaining necessary licenses and permits, 
diminishing quantities or grades of mineral reserves as mining occurs; global 
financial condition, the actual results of current exploration activities, 
changes to conclusions of economic evaluations, and changes in project 
parameters to deal with un-anticipated economic or other factors, risks of
increased capital and operating costs, we are affected by environmental, safety 
or regulatory risks, expropriation, the Company&#8217;s title to properties 
including ownership thereof, increased competition in the mining industry for 
properties, equipment, qualified personnel and their costs, risks relating to 
the uncertainty of timing of events including targeted production rate increase 
and currency fluctuations.<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font> Shareholders are cautioned not to place 
undue reliance on forward-looking information.&#160; By its nature, forward-
looking information involves numerous assumptions, inherent risks and 
uncertainties, both general and specific, that contribute to the possibility 
that the predictions, forecasts, projections and various future events will not 
occur.&#160; Caledonia reviews forward-looking information for the purposes of 
preparing each MD&amp;A, however Caledonia undertakes no obligation to update 
publicly or otherwise revise any forward-looking information whether as a result
of new information, future events or other such factors which affect this 
information, except as required by law.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zfbfb4481f0d14cf9ba179b92d16c4a69" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; align: right">19.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">CONTROLS</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Caledonia maintains 
adequate systems of internal accounting and administrative controls, consistent 
with reasonable cost. Such systems are designed to provide reasonable assurance 
that relevant and reliable financial information is produced.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Management is 
responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal controls over 
financial reporting (&#8220;ICFR&#8221;). Any system of internal controls over 
financial reporting, no matter how well designed, has inherent limitations. 
Therefore, even those systems determined to be effective can provide only 
reasonable assurance with respect to financial statement preparation and 
presentation.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At June 30, 2016 we 
have tested our ICFR and management has evaluated the effectiveness of 
Caledonia&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting and concluded that 
such internal control over financial reporting was effective and there were no 
material weaknesses. As part of their monitoring and oversight role, the Audit 
Committee performs a review and conducts discussions with management. No 
material exceptions were noted based on the additional procedures and no 
evidence of fraudulent activity was found.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Segregation of Duties</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Management has 
concluded, and the Audit Committee has agreed, that the hiring of additional 
staff needs to be constantly addressed and assessed in light of risks to ICFR 
and the costs associated with additional staff.&#160; There have been no changes
in the Corporation&#8217;s internal controls over financial reporting since the 
year ended December 31, 2015, that have materially affected, or are reasonably 
likely to materially affect, its internal controls over financial 
reporting.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">27</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Corporation has a
Disclosure Committee consisting of three Directors, and has disclosure controls 
and procedures which it follows in an attempt to ensure that it complies with 
all required disclosures on an adequate and timely basis.&#160; The 
Corporation&#8217;s Directors and Management, and the Disclosure Committee, are 
making all reasonable efforts to ensure that the Corporation&#8217;s disclosures
are made in full compliance with all of the applicable rules, regulations and 
requirements.&#160; All reasonable efforts are also being made to ensure that 
the Corporation&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures provide reasonable 
assurance that material information relating to the Corporation, including its 
consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to the Corporation&#8217;s Certifying 
Officers by others within those entities.</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 3pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt"><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">20</font><font style="WIDTH: 36pt; DISPLAY: inline-block; FONT-
SIZE: 1px" id="TRGRRTFtoHTMLTab">&#160;</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">QUALIFIED 
PERSON</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-TOP: 6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dr. Trevor Pearton, 
</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">B.Sc. Eng. (Mining Geology), Ph.D. (Geology), Pr.Sci.Nat., 
F.G.S.S.A.,</font><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"> VP Exploration is the Corporation&#8217;s qualified person as 
defined by NI 43-101.&#160; Dr. Pearton is responsible for the technical 
information provided in this MD&amp;A except where otherwise 
stated.</font>&#160;<font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dr. Pearton has reviewed the scientific and technical 
information included in this document and has approved the disclosure of this 
information for the purposes of this MD&amp;A.</font></div>
<div id="DSPFPageFooter">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 21.6pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></div>
<div>&#160;</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-

 &#160;</div>
<div>

<div><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New

Chief Executive Officer of Caledonia Mining Corporation</font>, certify the 
following:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">

have reviewed the interim financial report and interim MD&amp;A (together, the 
&#8220;interim filings&#8221;) of <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman',

Corporation</font> (the &#8220;issuer&#8221;) for the quarter ended <font

</tr>

diligence, the interim filings do not contain any untrue statement of a material
fact or omit to state a material fact required to be stated or that is necessary
to make a statement not misleading in light of the circumstances under which it 
was made, with respect to the period covered by the interim filings.</td>

together with the other financial information included in the interim filings 
fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, financial 
performance and cash flows of the issuer, as of the date of and for the periods 
presented in the interim filings.</div>

<div>

<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<div id="DSPFPageHeader"></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Form 52-109F2</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Certification of Interim Filings</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Full Certificate</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">John Mark Learmonth, 
Chief Financial Officer of Caledonia Mining Corporation</font>, certify the 
following:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z61f39d7f5f404436a2257ff81de201a3" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">1.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Review: </font>I 
have reviewed the interim financial report and interim MD&amp;A (together, the 
&#8220;interim filings&#8221;) of <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Caledonia Mining 
Corporation</font> (the &#8220;issuer&#8221;) for the quarter ended <font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">June 30, 2016</font>.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-

cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>

<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">No 
misrepresentations: </font>Based on my knowledge, having exercised reasonable 
diligence, the interim filings do not contain any untrue statement of a material
fact or omit to state a material fact required to be stated or that is necessary
to make a statement not misleading in light of the circumstances under which it 
was made, with respect to the period covered by the interim filings.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z751e2a97842f4f7cb2144dd8e3165d83" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">3.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Fair presentation:
</font>Based on my knowledge, having exercised reasonable diligence, the interim
financial report together with the other financial information included in the 
interim filings fairly present in all material respects the financial condition,
financial performance and cash flows of the issuer, as of the date of and for 
the periods presented in the interim filings.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z5847245eeff2443ba9e09baa64375b5d" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">4.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Responsibility: 
</font>The issuer&#8217;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for 
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (DC&amp;P) and 
internal control over financial reporting (ICFR), as those terms are defined in 
National Instrument 52-109 Certification of Disclosure in Issuers&#8217; Annual 
and Interim Filings, for the issuer.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zf5b46ad196104d6882bf979dff413173" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">5.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">Design:</font>&#160; Subject to the limitations, if any, described in 
paragraphs 5.2 and 5.3, the issuer&#8217;s other certifying officer and I have, 
as at the end of the period covered by the interim filings</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zfffa470c64a043a5aed4cc7b900e8166" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(a)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">designed DC&amp;P, or caused it to 
be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance that</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="z8f42d1d60b344cec8e819cf5b9e79720" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 72pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(i)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">material information relating to 
the issuer is made known to us by others, particularly during the period in 
which the interim filings are being prepared; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zc2cec7e378b84a8db7f04678d77bb464" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 72pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(ii)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">information required to be 
disclosed by the issuer in its annual filings, interim filings or other reports 
filed or submitted by it under securities legislation is recorded, processed, 
summarized and reported within the time periods specified in securities 
legislation; and</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zd5190a63776e4a7b8e3a5e41d5ea7717" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt"></td>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">(b)</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">designed ICFR, or caused it to be 
designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the 
reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements 
for external purposes in accordance with the issuer&#8217;s GAAP.</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt" id="zbdbff776ec494d0c98d68357c0ade014" class="DSPFListTable" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; align: right">5.1</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Control 
framework:</font>&#160; The control framework the issuer&#8217;s other 
certifying officer and I used to design the issuer&#8217;s ICFR is the Internal 
Control &#8211; Integrated Framework &#8211; published by the Committee of 
Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO).</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>

in ICFR: </font>The issuer has disclosed in its interim MD&amp;A any change in 
the issuer&#8217;s ICFR that occurred during the period beginning on <font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
WEIGHT: bold">April 1, 2016 </font>and ended on <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">June 30, 2016 
</font>that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially 
affect, the issuer&#8217;s ICFR.</td>
